finding: The polymorphism rs13064994 was associated with MASP-3 serum concentrations in healthy individuals, where carriers of the T variant had higher MASP-3 levels compared to C/C homozygotes (medians 6,022 ng/mL vs. 5,086 ng/mL, P=0.0103). However, in leprosy patients, the association disappeared as MASP-3 levels decreased regardless of genotype.

The rs1109452 T variant was associated with lower MASP-3 levels in controls but did not display differences between healthy and diseased carriers. Additionally, MASP-1 serum concentrations were higher in rs1109452 T carriers compared to C/C homozygotes.

The rs850314 minor A allele was linked to higher MASP-3 levels in healthy individuals (6,373 ng/mL vs. 5,450 ng/mL for G/G homozygotes, P=0.0342), but like other SNPs, the association did not hold in leprosy patients who had generally lower MASP-3 levels.

The SNP rs13081871 was associated with aggressive melanoma characteristics, correlating with the findings that enhanced lysosomal spreading and positioning influenced protease secretion and matrix degradation in melanoma cells. The original research indicated that alterations in lysosomal positioning, as influenced by genetic factors such as rs13081871, were significantly linked to invasive outgrowth in a zebrafish model, demonstrating the important role of this SNP in the tumor aggressiveness and metastatic potential.
title: Peripheral positioning of lysosomes supports melanoma aggressiveness

finding: The SNP rs13092025 was highlighted in the research as being associated with the risk factors and epidemiology of colorectal cancer. This variant was linked to insights on patient demographics and potential therapeutic considerations based on its differential expression in tumor versus normal tissues.
title: Identification of cuproptosis and ferroptosis-related subtypes and development of a prognostic signature in colon cancer

finding: This SNP was located near EOMES and showed associations with a P-value of 1.3 x 10^-8 and replicated with 1.4 x 10^-8. It highlighted chromatin accessibility in the fetal cortex and was implicated in microcephaly through loss of EOMES expression.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: Identified as a fetal cortex eQTL for RPSA, this SNP had a P-value of 8.4 x 10^-11 and replicated with 3.7 x 10^-12. The protein it encodes plays a potential role in neurogenesis and neuronal differentiation.
title: The genetic architecture of the human cerebral cortex

finding: The rs17713054 SNP of LZTFL1 represented a G>A mutation that was associated with the regulation of LZTFL1 expression in lung tissues. This SNP was linked to a CCAAT/enhancer binding protein beta motif and was implicated in increasing the risk of different cancer types as well as influencing COVID-19 infection outcomes. Specifically, findings indicated that this SNP facilitated the expression of LZTFL1 in lung samples, which correlated with an essential role of LZTFL1 in epithelial-mesenchymal transition, a process vital for immune response in lung epithelial cells. Furthermore, the study observed that downstream genes regulated by LZTFL1 were downregulated in various COVID-19 affected lung cell models, thus suggesting a protective role of LZTFL1 against COVID-19 infection and highlighting its potential impact on survival rates in patients with kidney renal clear cell carcinoma (KIRC), rectum adenocarcinoma (READ), and uveal melanoma (UVM).
title: A pan-cancer analysis of the oncogenic role of COVID-19 risk gene Leucine Zipper Transcription Factor-Like Protein 1 (LZTFL1) in human tumors

finding: The variant rs9310935, located near IL5RA, was found to be significantly associated with the latent factor ML8, showing moderate evidence with a p-value of 3.3×10^-8. It exhibited effects on multiple basophil-related traits and was previously detected in a meta-analysis for basophil count.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The rs10490770 SNP was reported to be in perfect linkage disequilibrium with leading risk polymorphisms in Eurasian populations. It was found in haplotypes of carriers that align with Neandertal genomes, suggesting its association with increased risk for severe outcomes in SARS-CoV-2 infections.
title: The major genetic risk factor for severe COVID-19 is inherited from Neandertals

finding: The eQTL variant rs62292793 was found to disrupt an IRF1 binding motif located upstream of the RTP4 gene promoter, which led to reduced RTP4 expression. This finding illustrated the potential impact of eQTL variants on transcription factor binding and subsequent gene regulation.
title: Mapping interindividual dynamics of innate immune response at single-cell resolution

finding: This SNP was linked to the modulation of transcription factor binding in K562 cells, affecting motifs including Atf3/MAFG::NFE2L1, indicating its regulatory significance.
title: RSAT Var-tools: an accessible and flexible framework to predict the impact of regulatory variants on transcription factor binding

finding: This SNP near ADCY5 showed directional consistency and limited nominal significance in external analyses, indicating it was a novel signal for BMI.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene KLHDC8B and was also found to be in LD with a SNP related to smoking cessation. This finding signifies a possible shared genetic mechanism between AUD and smoking behaviors.
title: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Splicing Associations with Problematic Alcohol Use and Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: Associated with smoking cessation, this SNP was noted to be in LD with SNP rs3819325. Its importance was highlighted in relation to the pathophysiology of AUD, indicating potential shared genetic pathways.
title: Genome- and Transcriptome-wide Splicing Associations with Problematic Alcohol Use and Alcohol Use Disorder

finding: The study reported that a genetic variation at SNP rs10470352 was identified within the SOX2-SE region. This finding arose from a joint analysis of genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and HiChIP data. It was demonstrated that this sequence variation facilitates the occupancy of TP73 and RUNX3 transcription factors, leading to the promotion of active chromatin and an upregulation of SOX2 expression, indicating its role in gastric cancer pathology.
title: Super-enhancer-driven ZFP36L1 promotes PD-L1 expression in infiltrative gastric cancer

finding: The SNP rs6795970 in the SCN10A gene was associated with a hypoalgesic inflammatory bowel disease phenotype. This finding suggested that homozygosity for this polymorphism may influence pain perception in patients suffering from inflammatory bowel disease, potentially indicating the gene's role in nociceptive pathways.
title: Structural basis of inhibition of human NaV1.8 by the tarantula venom peptide Protoxin-I

finding: This SNP was part of the significant gene-based association for CSF YKL-40 levels associated with the CPOX gene, but the functional implications remained less clear given the lack of eQTL data.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: The DRD3 gene rs6280 polymorphism was associated with alcohol dependence overall, and it was specifically linked to Lesch type I alcohol dependence in Korean populations. This finding provides a genetic basis for understanding individual variability in alcohol dependence, particularly in specific ethnic groups.
title: Transcriptional analysis of neuronal ensembles of alcohol memories within the nucleus accumbens

finding: The SNP rs28576629 was associated with rhythm impairment and dyslexia in a study that identified this variant as the strongest signal among the significant loci. This SNP is an intronic variant in the PPP2R3A gene, which encodes a regulatory subunit of protein phosphatase 2. The association was confirmed through multiple genome-wide association study methodologies.
title: The shared genetic architecture and evolution of human language and musical rhythm

finding: The SNP rs7617480 was identified as having a strong association with the novel gene NDUFAF3, which plays a role in brain function. It demonstrated a Z-score of -5.0785 and a P value of 3.80×10^-7, confirming its significance in major depression research. It was noted that NDUFAF3 is targeted by Metformin, a first-line treatment for type-2 diabetes.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of major depression aids locus discovery, fine-mapping, gene prioritisation, and causal inference

finding: The SNP rs2228243 was part of a cohort of SNPs associated with HRG levels, although detailed P-values specific to this SNP were not mentioned. The association aligns with previous studies linking plasma HRG levels to this variant, indicative of its relevance in mediating HRG concentrations and possibly influencing disease risk.
title: Profiles of circulating histidine-rich glycoprotein associate with chronological age and risk of all-cause mortality

finding: The SNP rs13081946 was identified in the study by Cendrowicz et al., published in 2021, which examined the role of macrophages in cancer development and therapy. This finding indicated a significant association between variations at this locus and the immune response in tumor microenvironments, demonstrating its relevance to cancer-related phenotypes.
title: The role of noise in the tumour-immune interactions reveals memoryless shifting response

finding: This SNP was linked to differentiation pathways, disrupting key transcriptional motifs affecting disease susceptibility.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: This SNP’s interactions with multiple cancer-related peak SNPs underscored its relevance in ongoing cancer research.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs13081931 was identified in a study as having relevance in the context of Mycosis fungoides (MF), where it was associated with the molecular drivers and pathophysiology of the disease. This particular SNP was linked to the abnormal activation of T cell signalling pathways that contribute to the disease's progression, particularly in the presence of a pathogenic strain of S. aureus. The activation patterns showed significant variation among patients and were influenced by microbial factors, illustrating a complex interaction between genetics, the microbiome, and immune response in MF.
title: Multiomic Data Integration Reveals Microbial Drivers of Aetiopathogenesis in Mycosis Fungoides

finding: The transferrin rs3811647 variant showed potential association with multiple sclerosis (MS) origin according to research.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: Transferrin rs1049296 was implicated in the origin of multiple sclerosis (MS), according to findings from a 2022 article.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs17279437 Thr199Met variant was found to be associated with widespread reductions in sulcal width and had previous associations with reduced thickness of retinal components and increased glycine and proline derivatives in CSF and urine, highlighting proline/glycine pathways in regulating brain sulcal widths.
title: Genetic map of regional sulcal morphology in the human brain

finding: The rs1354034 (T/C) variant located within the ARHGEF3 gene was associated with three co-expression modules in platelets, specifically one ICA module (IC68, 1,074 genes) and two other modules (X6.WIERENGA_STAT5A_TARGETS_DN and Cluster_12953). The T allele of rs1354034 increased the expression of ARHGEF3 in cis, and both cis and trans-eQTLs colocalised with GWAS hits for mean platelet volume and platelet count.
title: Co-expression analysis reveals interpretable gene modules controlled by trans-acting genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs115981379 (C>T) was identified within CTNNB1 and was associated with varying expression levels of CTNNB1 in esophagus and transverse colon samples from the GTEx database.
title: Wnt signaling dosage controlled by a Ctnnb1 enhancer balances homeostasis and tumorigenesis of intestinal epithelia

finding: The Ala986Ser SNP (rs1801725) was positively associated with serum calcium concentrations, significantly contributing to the variance in serum Ca<sup>2+</sup> levels in the general population. The study highlighted a strong positive association with CAD risk, indicated by a p-value of 1.6E-70 and a beta of 0.07255, making it a reiterative finding in relation to cardiovascular diseases.
title: Calcium Sensing Receptor Common Variants Influence the Effects of Serum Calcium on Coronary Artery Disease Risks

finding: The Arg990Gly SNP (rs1042636) presented a negative association with serum calcium concentrations and CAD risk. It was shown to reduce CAD risk significantly, with a p-value of 5.75E-15 and a beta of -0.0442. This SNP also correlated with a decrease in the CAD risk factor of chronic kidney disease, independent of other cardiovascular risk factors.
title: Calcium Sensing Receptor Common Variants Influence the Effects of Serum Calcium on Coronary Artery Disease Risks

finding: The variant rs7615045 was associated with body mass, glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c), and type 2 diabetes. Similar to rs2209972, rs7615045's associations were validated through phenome-wide studies involving a large population, highlighting its specific relation to metabolic disorders including type 2 diabetes. This provides insight into the linkage between genetic variants at the IGF2BP2 locus and significant metabolic traits.
title: An adipocyte-specific lncRAP2 – Igf2bp2 complex enhances adipogenesis and energy expenditure by stabilizing target mRNAs

finding: The variant rs6438208 on ZBTB20 was identified as a GWS locus associated with smoking initiation in a larger population, confirming its previous association with this smoking-related phenotype.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: A novel locus associated with smoking initiation, the SNP rs4687552 on ITIH3 was identified in this study, enhancing the understanding of genetic factors in smoking behavior.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs6778080 on USP4 was recognized as a novel GWS locus for smoking initiation, indicating its functional relevance in smoking behaviors.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The variant rs56992000 also exhibited increased GATA4-DNA binding affinity. It led to a 2.1-fold increase in luciferase activity, highlighting its potential role in enhancing transcriptional activation by GATA4.
title: Cardiovascular Disease-Associated Non-Coding Variants Disrupt GATA4-DNA Binding and Regulatory Functions

finding: The rs9290877 SNP within LPP was associated with asthma, allergy, and plasma IgE levels, implicating it in the immune response relevant to EGPA.
title: Genetically distinct clinical subsets, and associations with asthma and eosinophil abundance, within Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis

finding: The SNP rs167924, located at the 3' end of CD47 and close to the BBX gene, was associated with platelet levels, indicating its relevance in modulating platelet counts in individuals.
title: SIRPα controls CD47-dependent platelet clearance in mice and humans

finding: This SNP was associated with chromatin accessibility and found to influence the expression of the <italic>CHL1</italic> gene in progenitors through altering chromatin accessibility. It demonstrated high allele-specific chromatin accessibility but did not show significant association with gene expression in neurons.
title: Inferring cell-type-specific causal gene regulatory networks during human neurogenesis

finding: The SNP rs551879660 was associated with longitudinal cocaine use, reaching genome-wide significance with a P-value of 2.00 × 10^-8. This finding suggests a link between genetically influenced traits and cocaine use.
title: Retrospective Association Analysis of Longitudinal Binary Traits Identifies Important Loci and Pathways in Cocaine Use

finding: Linked to lipid measures. Its association indicated a potential influence of Neandertal ancestry on lipid metabolism.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The rs2269350 SNP in the RPSA gene in iBCs indicated a decrease in the expression of the reference allele followed by an increase in the expression of the alternative allele after 72 hpi. This finding showcased the differential regulatory effects on gene expression brought about by SARS-CoV-2.
title: Differential haplotype expression in class I MHC genes during SARS-CoV-2 infection of human lung cell lines

finding: The SNP rs56084453 was attributed to downregulation of the ZNF502 gene and was associated with significant immune system functions, showing differentiation between Pitta and Kapha individuals.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: Findings for SNP rs13071583 showed that it was implicated in the dual role of 17β-Estradiol, balancing between DNA damage and maintaining genome integrity in cancerous cells. This SNP's influence was significant within the context of estrogen signaling and breast cancer.
title: Heat Shock Factor 1 (HSF1) as a new tethering factor for ESR1 supporting its action in breast cancer

finding: The SNP rs13081766 was associated with the BTLA/HVEM axis which induced NK cell immunosuppression. This finding indicated a potential poor clinical outcome in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia, highlighting the relevance of NK cell regulation in immunological responses, particularly in conditions involving immune dysfunctions such as biliary atresia.
title: Human endogenous retrovirus activation contributes to biliary atresia pathogenesis through re-education of resident macrophages

finding: The SNP rs13092235 was associated with modulating the Ubiquitin Proteasome System (UPS) which was highlighted in the context of genome stability and cancer. In this study, dysfunctionality of the UPS was noted to have implications on DNA damage repair mechanisms. The research emphasized the importance of this SNP in potential pathological mechanisms underlying neurodegenerative diseases, particularly in the context of DNA damage repair related to alpha-synuclein aggregation in synucleinopathies.
title: Post-mortem evidence for a reciprocal relationship between genomic DNA damage and alpha-synuclein pathology in dementia with Lewy bodies

finding: The rs5743836 TLR9 minor C allele was associated with a greater incidence of gastric intestinal metaplasia (GIM) and gastric cancer (GAC) in two independent Asian cohorts. In these studies, subjects with atrophy and intestinal metaplasia exhibited a higher frequency of the minor C allele compared to those with only gastritis. In gastric biopsies, candidates carrying at least one C allele showed increased expression of TLR9, IFN-alpha, and SLFN12L, correlating with the presence of <Helicobacter> infection. Additionally, the presence of this allele created an NF-kB binding site, linking it to heightened risk factors for neoplastic complications from chronic <Helicobacter> infection.
title: Toll Like Receptor 9 Pathway Mediates Schlafen+-MDSC Polarization During Helicobacter-Induced Gastric Metaplasias

finding: SNP rs9820286 at locus 3q21.3 was associated with protection against several retinal disease endophenotypes, including retinal holes and detachment.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The analysis demonstrated that the enhancer activity of the rs6801957 centered construct was completely rescued by the deletion allele, indicating that the reference allele likely acted as a repressive transcription factor binding site. This finding suggested that the alternate allele did not exhibit the same repressive effects, highlighting the critical role of the sequence surrounding this SNP in enhancer function.
title: Functional characterization of QT interval associated SCN5A enhancer variants identify combined additive effects

finding: The rs7373779 centered enhancer showed reduced activity from the deletion allele when compared to both reference and alternate alleles. This indicated that the deletion likely removed critical transcription factor binding sites, particularly the predicted binding site for GATA2, which was confirmed through oligo-based pulldown assays.
title: Functional characterization of QT interval associated SCN5A enhancer variants identify combined additive effects

finding: Enhancer assays indicated that the reference allele of rs41312411 was bound by SP1 and exhibited significantly higher activity than the deletion allele, which lacked the SP1 binding site. The alternate allele did not bind SP1 but maintained activity due to contributions from other transcription factors.
title: Functional characterization of QT interval associated SCN5A enhancer variants identify combined additive effects

finding: The enhancer activity for rs11710077 was the highest for the reference allele due to predicted binding of ERF/ELK1, while the alternate allele’s lower activity was supported by the presence of a repressive factor. The deletion allele was found to create a novel binding site, partially restoring enhancer activity.
title: Functional characterization of QT interval associated SCN5A enhancer variants identify combined additive effects

finding: The SNP rs7642482, located on chromosome 3p12.3 near the ROBO2 gene, was identified as associated with expressive vocabulary in infants (aged 15-18 months) in a previous meta-genome-wide association study. However, this association was reported to be attenuated in toddlers (aged 24-30 months), suggesting age-specific genetic mechanisms impacting vocabulary development.
title: Genome-wide analyses of vocabulary size in infancy and toddlerhood: associations with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder and cognition-related traits

finding: The SNP rs9854781 passed the unadjusted genome-wide significance threshold in the study focused on early-phase expressive vocabulary (15-18 months). It was consistent with a known locus previously identified in a meta-GWAS, specifically matched with rs764282, showing a strong linkage disequilibrium (LD-r2=0.78). This indicated its significance in early language development.
title: Genome-wide analyses of vocabulary size in infancy and toddlerhood: associations with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder and cognition-related traits

finding: The SNP rs16843927 was identified as a lead modQTL associated with SRS1 status and mortality. It showed evidence of colocalization with GWAS signals of inflammatory bowel disease and was linked to a module enriched with zinc finger genes involved in retroviral repression, indicating its potential role in the host response to sepsis.
title: eQTLs identify regulatory networks and drivers of variation in the individual response to sepsis

finding: The SNP rs2254298, which is a polymorphism in the oxytocin receptor gene, was shown to interact with familial risk for psychopathology to predict symptoms of depression and anxiety in adolescent girls. This finding highlighted the complex role that genetic factors, like the oxytocin receptor variants, play in mental health, suggesting that individuals with certain genotypes may be more susceptible to environmental influences related to their social contexts.
title: Genetic variation in the social environment affects behavioral phenotypes of oxytocin receptor mutants in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs2272522 was positively associated with schizophrenia in a study conducted in Qatar, demonstrating its significance in the context of genetic predisposition to this psychiatric disorder.
title: A role for the Erk MAPK pathway in modulating SAX-7/L1CAM-dependent locomotion in Caenorhabditis elegans

finding: The SNP rs2855558 showed a correlation between its derived allele frequency (A) and sunshine duration across various populations. This site exhibited selective sweep signatures in Finnish populations, with the derived A allele's age estimated to be around 20,000 years, aligning well post divergence of Europeans from East Asians. The allele frequency demonstrated significant variation highly correlated with local sunshine duration, underscoring its potential role in myopia adaptation.
title: Detection of adaptation to light environment in myopia-associated loci Diversity of the myopia genetic background

finding: The SNP rs55736314 was associated with educational attainment (EA) and was GWAS-significant, having a p-value of 1.63 x 10^-16, situated close to the 5' region of the FOXP1 gene, which is implicated in cognitive function.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The SNP rs4677597, which was identified for schizophrenia (SCZ), had a p-value of 3.87 x 10^-7, just below traditional significance, and was also located near the 5' region of FOXP1, underlining its potential relevance in SCZ.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The index SNP for autism spectrum disorder (ASD), rs7616330, showed a more modest p-value of 2.26 x 10^-4, and its association signal fell towards the 3' end of FOXP1, indicating a regulatory role in ASD.
title: An approach to gene-based testing accounting for dependence of tests among nearby genes

finding: The rs60464856 variant showed significant predictive potential for regulating RUVBL1 gene expression in the BPH1 cell line with a multiome p-value of 0.0099. This finding was consistent with its previously reported regulatory role.
title: Identify Regulatory eQTLs by Multiome Sequencing in Prostate Single Cells

finding: The findings related to SNP rs13061380 indicated its role in the genetic mechanisms underlying cancer evolution, highlighting this SNP as a significant positive original finding in cancer research.
title: Understanding and leveraging phenotypic plasticity during metastasis formation

finding: The SNP rs2241766 in the ADIPOQ gene was associated with a predisposition to diabetic kidney disease (DKD), highlighting its role as a genetic risk factor during the pathogenesis of DKD.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The rs4618210 SNP in the PLCL2 gene was associated with an increased risk of myocardial infarction, emphasizing its importance in cardiovascular health.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs2713575 was located in an intronic region near GATA2 and was associated with varicose veins (VVs) with a P-value of 1.82×10^-36.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The lead SNP rs17759085 located on chromosome 3 was another significant locus for the vertical component. It exhibited an additive effect of -5.46 for increasing T alleles, a minor allele frequency of 19.90%, and a p-value of 4.83e-08.
title: Handedness and Other Variables Associated with Human Brain Asymmetrical Skew

finding: The study described the wildtype \'SCN5A\' used, which contained the more common H allele of the H558R polymorphism (rs1805124). This polymorphism was referenced in the context of assessing the functional properties of \'SCN5A\' variants related to Brugada Syndrome (BrS1). It was implied that this SNP was relevant for understanding the overall structural and functional implications of mutations within the channel.
title: High-throughput reclassification of SCN5A variants

finding: This synonymous variant located in ILDR1 also contributed significantly to hearing difficulty in the UK Biobank, with a p-value of 1.1e-8, reinforcing its association with Mendelian hearing impairments.
title: Biological insights from multi-omic analysis of 31 genomic risk loci for adult hearing difficulty

finding: The SNP rs993137 was identified as a significant lead SNP associated with general risk tolerance, demonstrating a strong association (P = 2.14×10<sup>-40</sup>) and located within the gene CADM2. This finding was part of a larger analysis where general risk tolerance was found to be genetically correlated to various risky behaviors, highlighting the importance of this SNP in understanding the genetic basis of risk-related traits.
title: Genome-wide association analyses of risk tolerance and risky behaviors in over 1 million individuals identify hundreds of loci and shared genetic influences1

finding: The i-rQTL of PARP9-204 was co-localized with GWAS findings for LDL cholesterol levels, with variant rs3762637 showing a high RTC score (0.98) and perfect LD correlation (r^2 = 1.00).
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: Published effects of rs35124509 in the EPHA3 gene showed significant relatedness to functional brain activity in various analyses.
title: Common variants contribute to intrinsic human brain functional networks

finding: The SNP rs9820529 was found to be an apaQTL in the EIF2A gene, showing differences in polyadenylation site usage among genotypes. The study revealed correlations between this SNP and normalized mRNA expression, ribosome occupancy, and protein expression levels, indicating its influence on gene regulation through APA.
title: Alternative polyadenylation mediates genetic regulation of gene expression

finding: The SNP rs13071609 was identified in relation to the coupling of epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) to extracellular matrix (ECM) stiffness. This finding was derived from the research by Deng et al. in 2021, which illustrated how EMT processes might be influenced by the mechanical properties of the ECM, indicating that genetic variations at this locus could modify cellular responses during EMT.
title: Epigenetic memory acquired during long-term EMT induction governs the recovery to the epithelial state

finding: The SNP at locus 3p24.1 (rs35356316) was identified as genome-wide significant, lying near genes potentially involved in retinal function.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The variant rs11917071 was connected with increased TREX1 expression and lower odds of being an ICB responder, highlighting its role as an immunoinhibitory target.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: This SNP showed association with decreased TREX1 expression and higher odds of being an ICB responder, illustrating its dual role in influencing immune landscapes.
title: Germline modifiers of the tumor immune microenvironment implicate drivers of cancer risk and immunotherapy response

finding: The SNP rs14434 in the 3' UTR of EIF2A proved to be both a pA-QTL and an eQTL. The analysis revealed that the C allele associated with rs14434 decreased pA usage at the p(A) site, resulting in longer 3' UTRs and lower expression levels of EIF2A across all analyzed tissues, signifying a strong impact on gene expression via polyadenylation regulation.
title: Systematic identification of functional SNPs interrupting 3’ UTR polyadenylation signals

finding: The SNP rs73058498 was associated with CSF levels of proline at the SACM1L locus on chromosome 3, showing a significant association with <italic>P</italic>=1.88e-12.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs2871960 was associated with the ZBTB38 locus, demonstrating its connection to height and underscoring its regulatory function.
title: DeepWAS: Multivariate genotype-phenotype associations by directly integrating regulatory information using deep learning

finding: The rs35518479 variant in the CHDH gene was identified as a cis-expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for CHDH expression in postmortem brains from schizophrenia patients. A significant association was observed between the A allele carriers and increased CHDH expression levels compared to G/G homozygotes (p = 0.03). Additionally, although no significant differences were found in overall betaine and SAM levels among the different genotypes, the SAM/SAH ratio, which indicates methylation index, was significantly higher in A allele carriers (p = 0.02). This finding suggested a potential link between CHDH expression and the methionine-homocysteine cycle associated with schizophrenia.
title: Investigation of betaine as a novel psychotherapeutic for schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs237887 was associated with an increased risk of depression specifically in pregnant women who had experienced early abuse. This finding suggested that variations in the oxytocin system could influence mental health outcomes in vulnerable populations.
title: Natural variation in oxytocin receptor signaling causes widespread changes in brain transcription: a link to the natural killer gene complex

finding: The SNP rs4687102 was identified as linked to psoriasis risk by GWAS, showing dynamically increased transcription-directing activity during differentiation, particularly enhancing expression of TP63, a key transcription factor mis-expressed in psoriasis.
title: Disease-Linked Regulatory DNA Variants and Homeostatic Transcription Factors in Epidermis

finding: Linked to mode 2<sub>62</sub> and situated near gene GMNC, this SNP has been associated with Alzheimer’s disease endophenotypes, particularly regarding ptau 181 in cerebro-spinal fluid.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Linked to WNT7A, which regulates angiogenesis, this SNP was associated with height and trunk mass in the UK Biobank, illustrating its role in physical growth and development.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: The SNP rs996423 was associated with overall mortality in patients with differentiated thyroid cancers (DTCs), indicating its significant clinical relevance in cancer prognosis.
title: Disrupted in Renal Carcinoma 3 (DIRC3) impacts malignant phenotype and IGFBP5/IGF-1/Akt signaling axis in differentiated thyroid cancer

finding: The SNP rs7623455 was discovered in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) of Digit Symbol Substitution Test (DSST) scores among 4207 participants from the Long Life Family Study (LLFS). It showed a large protective effect, with an effect size of beta = 10.7, and reached genome-wide significance with a p-value of 2.7×10^-18. It was subsequently replicated in a combined Danish twin cohort, confirming its positive association with increased DSST scores.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: In the LLFS GWAS, rs9821776 was identified as one of the 20 genome-wide significant SNPs associated with processing speed, exhibiting protective effects on DSST scores. This variant was part of a cluster on chromosome 3 that included multiple rare protective variants, was replicated in the Danish cohort, and showed significant positive effects on cognitive performance.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: rs9821587 was among the 20 rare genetic variants associated with processing speed in the LLFS GWAS. It demonstrated significant protective effects on DSST scores and was replicated in the Danish twin cohort, reinforcing its association with enhanced cognitive performance.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs78704059, identified in the LLFS GWAS, also showed a positive association with processing speed on DSST scores. It was part of the cluster of significant variants on chromosome 3, confirmed in the Danish cohort for its protective effect on cognitive function.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The SNP rs140387800 was found in an intergenic region on chromosome 3 and showed a large protective effect size of beta = 40.5 in a repeated assessment analysis of DSST scores, indicating a significant positive impact on processing speed.
title: Rare Genetic Variants Correlate with Better Processing Speed

finding: The rs6437412-C variant was found to be associated with increased cortical cerebrospinal fluid and related hematological traits.
title: Deep learning based brain age prediction uncovers associated sequence variants

finding: In the study referenced by Sivakumar et al. (2021), the SNP rs13081776 was associated with the regulation of immune response in pancreatic cancer. The findings highlighted a connection between activated regulatory T-cells, dysfunctional and senescent T-cells, and their influence on immunity within the pancreatic cancer microenvironment. This relationship underscored the importance of immune cell dynamics in the progression of pancreatic conditions, including the presence of PanIN lesions.
title: Analysis of donor pancreata defines the transcriptomic signature and microenvironment of early pre-neoplastic pancreatic lesions

finding: The rs121913273 variant in the PIK3CA gene was identified in 3 patients and classified as likely pathogenic in the Varsome database. This variant has been linked to functional effects in esophageal and squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck as well as in uterine cervical neoplasms, indicating its potential relevance in ASCC prognosis.
title: Comprehensive characterization of the mutational landscape in localized anal squamous cell carcinoma

finding: The SNP rs9811581 showed connections to the genes DTX3L and FBXO2 1, indicating its potential importance in the genetic architecture underlying Alzheimer's disease.
title: Deep multi-omic network fusion for marker discovery of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This SNP was associated with both monocyte and eosinophil counts, indicating its role in regulating the interaction between these cell types.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: This SNP was linked to monocyte counts, suggesting its importance in the functioning of monocytes, potentially impacting differentiation and function.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: This SNP was similarly associated with monocyte counts, indicating its relevance in the context of ACKR2's role in monocyte and eosinophil interactions.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: This SNP was associated with eosinophil counts, suggesting its influence on eosinophil levels and their interaction within the immune response.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: This SNP was linked to eosinophil counts, reinforcing the role of ACKR2 in controlling eosinophil activity and their interactions with other immune cells.
title: Eosinophils promote monocyte to macrophage differentiation and anti-bacterial immunity

finding: The variant allele of TLR9 polymorphism rs5743836 (C allele) was associated with a decreased risk of uterine corpus endometrial cancer (UCEC), with an odds ratio of 0.11 (95% CI 0.03-0.44, p = 0.002). The study suggested that the high activity C allele may allow for a better response to pathogenic microbes present in the endometrium.
title: Pattern Recognition Receptor based Prognostic Biomarkers for predicting Survival of Uterine Corpus Endometrial Cancer Patients

finding: The variant allele of TLR9 polymorphism rs187084 (C allele) was associated with a decreased risk in UCEC when combined with rs5743836 (C allele). The odds ratio was 0.11 (95% CI 0.03-0.44, p = 0.002), indicating a significant association that suggests a potential protective role against UCEC.
title: Pattern Recognition Receptor based Prognostic Biomarkers for predicting Survival of Uterine Corpus Endometrial Cancer Patients

finding: The SNP rs13092107 was associated with the identification of astrocyte-like and oligodendrocyte-like tumoral cells in diffuse IDH1-mutant gliomas. This study highlighted the role of NOTCH1 signaling in the genesis of these cell types, which relates to the context of glioblastoma and its stem-like characteristics.
title: KAT5 regulates neurodevelopmental states associated with G0-like populations in glioblastoma

finding: SNP rs568408 (G/A) in the IL12A gene was associated with 13 different bacteriophage groups, indicating its significant influence on phage presence, likely affecting immune regulation.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: SNP rs4684677 in the GHRL gene was linked to Kuttervirus, which predominantly infects Escherichia and Salmonella, further illustrating the impact of metabolic factors on phage composition.
title: Triadic Dynamics of Gastric Bacterial Microbiome, Phageome, and Host Genotype, with Implications for Disease Associations

finding: Analysis revealed that rs9853321 acted as the primary genetic instrument for the <italic>RNF13</italic> sub-network in subcutaneous fat, highlighting its association with cortisol metabolism and related gene interactions.
title: Gene networks driven by genetic variation for plasma cortisol in hepatic and adipose tissues implicate corticosteroid binding globulin in modulating tissue glucocorticoid action and cardiovascular risk

finding: The SNP rs1080500 was identified as a possible causal variant by MetaChrom, with its effects likely restricted to adult neurons. It was also found to be an eQTL in the adult brain, with GNL3 being the likely target gene. GNL3 is known for its role in regulating neuron differentiation, suggesting its significance in the context of neurodevelopment and potentially in SCZ.
title: Predicting Epigenomic Functions of Genetic Variants in the Context of Neurodevelopment via Deep Transfer Learning

finding: The SNP rs1800734 was originally identified as a non-coding variant that enhances the expression of DCLK3. It was found to facilitate long-range interactions that contribute to the progression of colorectal cancer. This finding highlighted the role of regulatory SNPs in promoting cancer-related gene expressions.
title: p63 cooperates with CTCF to modulate chromatin architecture in skin keratinocytes

finding: The SNP rs13071525 was connected to the FLT3/FLT3L signaling pathway which plays a significant role in the maturation and immunomodulatory functions of dendritic cells after traumatic brain injury (TBI). The study outlined that TBI significantly enhanced the transcription of genes associated with dendritic cell activation in the spleen, specifically indicating an induction of FLT3 and FLT3L three hours post-TBI. This induction facilitated the phosphorylation of the FLT3 receptor in CD11c+ dendritic cells, leading to increased protein synthesis of important mRNAs and upregulation of pro-inflammatory cytokines and proteins associated with dendritic cell maturation.
title: Fast maturation of splenic dendritic cells upon TBI is associated with FLT3/FLT3L signaling

finding: The SNP rs277627, located in intron 1 of the NIT2 gene, was associated with increased plasma levels of alpha-KGM at a significance level of p=2.0×10^-36. Variants GA and AA of rs277627 were linked to lower expression levels of NIT2 mRNA and protein in human vascular tissues, emphasizing the SNP's functional impact on NIT2 regulation and metabolic pathways.
title: The transaminase-ω-amidase pathway is a redox switch in glutamine metabolism that generates α-ketoglutarate

finding: The SNP rs12636284 was identified as a caQTL in type 1 muscle fibers, associated with significant chromatin accessibility characterized by a P value of 1.4x10^-63. This SNP's influence extended to FAPs with a P value of 2.4x10^-34, illustrating context-specific genetic effects on chromatin accessibility.
title: Population-scale skeletal muscle single-nucleus multi-omic profiling reveals extensive context specific genetic regulation

finding: This SNP was suggested to regulate TF expression in adipose tissue, influencing insulin sensitivity but not directly associated with transferrin levels. It served as a 'cis-glyQTL,' indicating variation in glycosylation linked to its own gene.
title: Same role but different actors: genetic regulation of post-translational modification of two distinct proteins

finding: The SNP rs13071609 showed relevance in the context of epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT), which is a critical process associated with tumor invasion and metastasis. This SNP was linked to alterations in ECM stiffness, potentially elucidating how genetic variations may influence ECM remodeling and subsequent tumor behavior in the setting of TNBC, particularly after radiation therapy.
title: Mammary Tissue-Derived Extracellular Matrix Hydrogels Reveal the Role of Irradiation in Driving a Pro-Tumor and Immunosuppressive Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs4855559 found in the intron of Myosin Heavy Chain 15 (MYH15) was significantly associated with Lifetime Anxiety Disorder, showing a p-value of 3.7×10−8, though its association did not replicate in Neuroticism or Depression analyses.
title: A Major Role for Common Genetic Variation in Anxiety Disorders

finding: The SNP rs4603973 was identified as a significant finding near the SATB1 locus associated with anxiety as measured by the GAD-2 scale. This association was reported with a p-value of 7.40×10−11, indicating a strong genetic signal for anxiety.
title: Reproducible Risk Loci and Psychiatric Comorbidities in Anxiety: Results from ~200,000 Million Veteran Program Participants

finding: The study identified rs17215589 as a variant that significantly altered the activation of the extended reward system in response to conditioned reward stimuli. Minor allele carriers exhibited increased activation in key brain regions such as the ventral tegmental area and the nucleus accumbens, suggesting that this variant might influence the vulnerability to mental disorders by modifying the reward system's function.
title: Impact of Unc-51 Like Kinase 4 (ULK4) on the Reactivity of the Extended Reward System in Response to Conditioned Stimuli

finding: The study found that the allele associated with increased baseline and lithium-induced GNL3 expression correlated with increased lithium-induced NPC proliferation. This SNP marked the locus on chromosome 3p21.1 which was significantly associated with the lithium-induced proliferation phenotype.
title: Cellular genome wide association study identifies common genetic variation influencing lithium induced neural progenitor proliferation

finding: The study indicated that SNP rs352140, similar to rs11709284, was also significantly associated with lithium-induced NPC proliferation, suggesting a complex locus where both SNPs contributed to the treatment response.
title: Cellular genome wide association study identifies common genetic variation influencing lithium induced neural progenitor proliferation

finding: SNP rs1108842 was associated with higher lithium-induced proliferation and increased GNL3 expression in response to lithium treatment, indicating its role in enhancing cellular response to lithium.
title: Cellular genome wide association study identifies common genetic variation influencing lithium induced neural progenitor proliferation

finding: The SNP rs2492286 located in RPN1 was associated with multiple unique traits, including cancers and blood cell counts, as well as being acknowledged as associated with IEAA in the present study.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP rs1047210 associated with IEAA colocalized with an eQTL for TRIM59, a gene with established connections to chronological age and cancer expression. Its association aligns with findings of other cancer-related genes in the study.
title: Genome-wide association studies identify 137 loci for DNA methylation biomarkers of ageing

finding: The SNP rs13071629 was identified as playing a significant role in the creation of artificial tumor microenvironments in neuroblastoma, as reported by Quinn et al. (2021). This finding highlighted its importance in studying neuroblastoma behavior and treatment responses.
title: Tumour growth: Bayesian parameter calibration of a multiphase porous media model based on in vitro observations of Neuroblastoma spheroid growth in a hydrogel microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs1405401 was located on chromosome 15, where the homozygous TT genotype corresponded to an 80% occurrence of white tuber flesh color. This SNP accounted for 18.04% of the phenotypic variance at Godet, indicating its strong association with the desired trait. It was situated near the gene Dioal.15G046900, coding for a potential receptor-like protein kinase.
title: Genome-wide association studies reveal novel loci controlling tuber flesh color and oxidative browning in Dioscorea alata

finding: The variant rs11719339 achieved an MpraVAE score of 0.993 and was found in an open chromatin region consistent across immune cell types. It interacted with the promoter region of the STAT2 gene, essential for immune responses. This finding confirmed the variant as a causal regulatory variant due to the established SNP-to-gene link.
title: In silico generation and augmentation of regulatory variants from massively parallel reporter assay using conditional variational autoencoder

finding: The association between the rs7627468 SNP and nephrolithiasis was confirmed with a significant p-value of 3.5 x 10^-5 in the study, establishing its role in the genetic predisposition to kidney stone disease.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The variant rs35779991-C was also associated with inflammation in esophagus mucosa, with a beta of 0.25 and a P-value of 8.87 × 10^-7. Notably, this variant was genome-wide significant in a GWAS for Body Mass Index (BMI), where it showed a beta of 0.018 and a P-value of 9.97 × 10^-12.
title: Self-supervised learning for characterising histomorphological diversity and spatial RNA expression prediction across 23 human tissue types

finding: This SNP was identified in association with coronary artery disease (CAD) as part of a GWAS involving over 100,000 Europeans. It serves as an eQTL for the gene MRAS, showing significant expression changes in multiple tissues related to CAD, including the artery and heart tissues. The C allele of rs2306374 was found to be associated with increased expression of MRAS in relevant tissues.
title: Qtlizer: comprehensive QTL annotation of GWAS results

finding: SNP rs9851766 was prioritized for functional studies due to its high linkage disequilibrium (r2 = 0.98) with study-wide significant variants. It is located within the 3' UTR of the MRAS gene near a predicted binding site for the microRNA hsa-miR-135-5p, which has been implicated in coronary artery disease, suggesting a potential regulatory role over MRAS expression.
title: Qtlizer: comprehensive QTL annotation of GWAS results

finding: This SNP was also prioritized, being intronic to the MRAS gene and located in a DNase I hypersensitivity site, indicating it may play a significant role in regulating MRAS expression. It showed high linkage disequilibrium (r2 = 0.94) with significant variants and was highlighted as the best QTL for MRAS in six studies focusing on heart and artery tissues.
title: Qtlizer: comprehensive QTL annotation of GWAS results

finding: Tagged by rs556788, the structural variant esv3597888 associated with the PCCB gene was found to have significant implications on metabolic processes and traits such as bilirubin levels and neuroticism.
title: Network-based analysis of allele frequency distribution among multiple populations identifies adaptive genomic structural variants

finding: rs2029591, located on chromosome 3p21.31, acted as an eQTL for multiple genes in brain tissues, including NCKIPSD, which is linked to synaptic activity. It showed a meta-analysis p-value of 5.9x10^-9 and was associated with mental health traits and cognitive abilities.
title: Investigating regions of shared genetic variation in attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and major depressive disorder: A GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The rs61791721 variant, associated with the gene PCCB, was linked to increased risk for coronary artery disease (CAD). The variant decreased PCCB activity, resulting in increased levels of propionyl-CoA and subsequent metabolic changes that elevated isoleucine and valine levels while altering cholesterol metabolism.
title: Integrative analysis of metabolite GWAS illuminates the molecular basis of pleiotropy and genetic correlation

finding: The variant rs12493830 had trans associations with proteins such as ICAM2, indicating that it was part of both CNV and pQTL mapping.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: This proxy SNP (rs10935473) related to a CNV affecting FLT4/VEGF-sR3 levels was identified among the measured proteins.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: The SNP rs78238620 was reported as a low frequency variant (MAF=5%) located in an intron of the KIF15 gene. The minor allele was associated with increased susceptibility to IPF and linked to decreased expression of KIF15 in brain tissue, suggesting a possible role in disease pathology.
title: Genome-wide association study of susceptibility to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

finding: The SNP rs7622814 on chromosome 3q13.2 was significantly associated with immune function in relation to asthma, identified as having a highly significant <italic>cis</italic> eQTL (P<1.0×10-300) in blood, implicating <italic>CD200R1</italic> as a potential candidate gene influencing asthma risk.
title: Large-scale Genetic Analysis Identifies 66 Novel Loci for Asthma

finding: The SNP rs13071606 was associated with an original finding related to breast cancer tissue microstructure as investigated in a study by Daimiel Naranjo et al. This study utilized multidimensional diffusion magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) for the characterization of tissue microstructure in breast cancer patients. The findings indicated that the SNP's associations contributed significant information in analyzing the cellular-scale structures influenced by tissue heterogeneity, thus showcasing potential relevance in understanding breast cancer pathology.
title: Frequency-dependence in multidimensional diffusion-relaxation correlation MRI of the brain: overfitting or meaningful parameter?

finding: Variant rs6778080 was reported as a pleiotropic variant for both lifetime smoking leading to WHR<sub>adjBMI</sub> and waist circumference adjusted for body mass index (WC<sub>adjBMI</sub>). The presence of this variant may amplify the effects of smoking on abdominal fat distribution.
title: Estimating the causal relationship between smoking and abdominal adiposity using Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs1801725 was identified in a study that reported an association between calcium-sensing receptor (CaSR) polymorphisms and an increased risk of secondary malignancies. This finding provided important insights into the role of CaSR-related genetic variations in influencing cancer risk.
title: Low Molecular Weight Hyaluronan Inhibits Lung Epithelial Ion Channels by Activating the Calcium-Sensing Receptor

finding: The SNP rs9871671 located in UROC1 was observed as a missense variant predicted to be damaging, indicating a significant association with mild malaria susceptibility.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The SNP rs13081780 was associated with the sensitivity of three-dimensional glioblastoma spheroids to temozolomide (TMZ). This finding was originally reported in a study that highlighted how oxidative stress-mediated DNA damage, influenced by the SNP, could enhance the effectiveness of TMZ in treating glioblastoma.
title: Ultrasound-mediated drug diffusion, uptake, and cytotoxicity in glioblastoma 3D tumour sphere model

finding: The SNP rs9586 was linked to broadly defined depression, confirming its previous association with mood disturbances.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The single nucleotide variant rs113408797 within the DNAJC13 gene was found to significantly influence brain activation in the ventral tegmental area (VTA) and the nucleus accumbens (NAcc) in response to conditioned reward stimuli, with p-values of 2.50E-07 and 5.31E-05, respectively. This evidence indicated a direct genetic influence on neural responses within the extended reward system.
title: DNAJC13 influences responses of the extended reward system to conditioned stimuli: a genome-wide association study

finding: This SNP was associated with risky behaviors and educational attainment, which included automobile speeding propensity (P = 4.4E-8) and educational attainment (P = 2.4E-7).
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: Like rs9869178, this SNP was related to risk behaviors and educational outcomes and was part of a broader discussion concerning behavioral traits influenced by genetic factors.
title: Diverse functions associate with trans-species polymorphisms in humans

finding: The SNP rs13061187 was reported in research that linked it to improved agronomic performance in wheat landraces and cultivars, serving as an important marker for drought adaptation.
title: Identification of QTL hotspots affecting agronomic traits and high-throughput vegetation indices in rainfed wheat

finding: The rs361072 promoter variant of the PIK3CB gene was associated with insulin resistance in obese and non-obese adults but not directly linked to type 2 diabetes.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The rs2254298 polymorphism in the oxytocin receptor gene showed an association with cardiovascular risk factors among Brazilian elderly.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The regulatory variant rs2535629 in ITIH3 was associated with schizophrenia risk by influencing gene expression.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: The TIMP-4 rs17035945 polymorphism was shown to provide protection against preeclampsia in a reported study.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Polycystic Ovary Syndrome and its Complications by Next Generation Squancing (NGS) and Bioinformatics Analysis

finding: SNP rs6801235 was found to have significant allelic differences in both cell lines and served as an eQTL for a gene in the cerebellar hemisphere, establishing its relevance in gene expression.
title: A screen of 1,049 schizophrenia and 30 Alzheimer’s-associated variants for regulatory potential

finding: Identified as having 11 sex-interacting rSNPs, rs1193510 was implicated in multiple functional impacts within the context of major depressive disorder across different brain regions.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: Found to have multiple rSNPs in a single condition (P10 female), this SNP was integral in establishing the significant number of functional variants within the loci associated with MDD.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: Similar to rs76931017, this SNP was linked to P10 female-specific regulatory activities, underscoring its relevance in understanding genetic risk factors for MDD.
title: Sex significantly impacts the function of major depression-linked variants in vivo

finding: The SNP rs114503684 on chromosome 3 achieved genome-wide significance among left heart lesion patients.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: SNP rs2046060 on chromosome 3 reached genome-wide significance in left heart lesions.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs187369228 on chromosome 3 was found close to the LEPREL1 gene in patients with ASDII.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The polymorphism rs53576 in the oxytocin receptor gene was found to be associated with bulimia nervosa, indicating its role in binge-purge tendencies in women. This finding correlated with the neurobiological aspects of BN/BED, suggesting that oxytocin may influence eating behaviors.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: Polymorphisms in the oxytocin receptor gene, particularly rs2254298, were linked to dysregulated eating behaviors in women, including binge eating. This association provided insights into the neurobiological underpinnings of eating disorders.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs2268493 was associated with overeating tendencies, aligning with the observed neurobiological findings related to bulimia nervosa and binge eating disorder. This suggests a genetic influence on eating behavior regulation.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: Similar to rs2268493, the polymorphism rs2268494 was implicated in overeating behaviors, supporting the notion that variations in the oxytocin receptor gene are significant in understanding binge eating and bulimia nervosa in women.
title: Investigating resting brain perfusion abnormalities and target-engagement by intranasal oxytocin in women with bulimia nervosa and binge-eating disorder and healthy controls

finding: The SNP rs13092014 was associated with aberrant sialylation patterns observed in cancer, particularly in relation to the N-glycoproteomic changes analyzed. This finding was significant in understanding potential biomarkers and therapeutic targets for colon cancer, as highlighted in the study by Pietrobono and Stecca (2021). The study underscored how variations in sialylation could contribute to cancer mechanisms and treatment strategies.
title: Comparative analyses of the N-glycoproteomes in HCT116 cancer cells and their non-tumorigenic DNMT1/3b double knockout (DKO1) cells and insight into the Mannose-6-phosphate pathway

finding: The SNP rs13092077 was associated with the regulation of the MAPK13 gene, which was implicated in the response of cancer cells to rapamycin. This SNP was identified in research conducted by Anton et al. in 2021, highlighting its relevance in oncogenic processes and potential drug resistance mechanisms.
title: MAPK13 stabilization via m6A modification limits anti-cancer efficacy of rapamycin

finding: The study found a significant gene-environment interaction involving the rs53576 SNP in the OXTR gene, which was related to race-based face categorization in adults. A notable negative correlation (r=-0.52, p<0.001) was observed between nanny experience and reaction time specifically for A/A homozygotes, indicating that their early interactions with caregivers of different races enhanced their perceptual expertise. However, no significant correlation was found for G-carriers, suggesting that these genetic factors differentially influenced social cognition based on personal experiences with other-race individuals.
title: Gene-environment interactions in face categorisation: experience with a nanny and oxytocin receptor genotype interact to reduce face categorization reaction times

finding: The SNP rs2230461 was located within the PIK3CA gene, which is noted to be the second most frequently mutated gene across all cancer types, with mutations occurring at least twice in 8-13% of clinical cases. This SNP was specifically mentioned in the context of phasing double PIK3CA mutations, where it could help in predicting oncogenicity and sensitivity to treatment, particularly when examined alongside the E545K and L866F mutations found on the same chromosomal copy.
title: Targeted Phasing of 2-200 Kilobase DNA Fragments with a Short-Read Sequencer and a Single-Tube Linked-Read Library Method

finding: The SNP rs73138519 was associated with decreased differentiation efficiency, specifically as a mesendo eQTL variant for DPH3. The analysis revealed that variation in this SNP influenced how effectively the differentiated cells progressed at a crucial time point.
title: Single-cell RNA-sequencing of differentiating iPS cells reveals dynamic genetic effects on gene expression

finding: The SNP rs13092005 was associated with cancer prognosis as noted in the analysis of the Genes Steadily Associated with Prognosis (GEARs). The study indicated that SNPs related to the CD151 tetraspanin, which is mentioned in the context of integrin-associated functions, could influence cancer development and progression. This aligns with the findings which suggest that tetraspanins like CD151 are crucial mediators of cancer signaling and cellular function.
title: Multi-gradient Permutation Survival Analysis Identifies Mitosis and Immune Signatures Steadily Associated with Cancer Patient Prognosis

finding: The SNP rs9826458 was classified as a Tier A candidate SNP with genome-wide significant associations in the RiskyBehavior GWAS (P = 4.36 x 10^-21) and the SmokingInitiation GWAS (P = 1.21 x 10^-14). It overlaps with relevant open chromatin regions, supporting its potential role in addiction-related genetic traits.
title: Addiction-associated genetic variants implicate brain cell type- and region-specific cis-regulatory elements in addiction neurobiology

finding: The SNP rs1354034 exhibited a strong non-additive association with platelet distribution width (P = 5.80 x 10^-90), associated with ARHGEF3 expression in platelets. It was noted that significant additive associations for platelet count and volume did not hold for distribution width (P = 0.825), thereby highlighting its non-additive effect.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2877561, a synonymous change in ILDR1, was fine-mapped to the genome-wide significant association with hearing difficulty/problems. It was noted to be associated with age-related hearing impairment, although it did not reach genome-wide significance in previous studies.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2306374, linked to the gene Mras, was found in a Sertoli cell-specific peak and associated with coronary artery disease (CAD) traits, showing a significant p-value of 6.49e-09.
title: The single-cell epigenetic regulatory landscape in mammalian perinatal testis development

finding: The SNP rs75968099 was identified as a significant contributor to the genetic risk associated with schizophrenia (SCZ) and bipolar disorder (BD). It was linked to the DCLK3 gene, which exhibited complex cell-specific regulation, indicating its potential role as a causal gene for these neuropsychiatric disorders. This finding emphasized the correlation between chromatin accessibility changes at this locus and gene expression dynamics during neuronal lineage commitment, reinforcing the significance of this SNP in the developmental context of the human brain.
title: Multi-omic profiling of the developing human cerebral cortex at the single cell level

finding: The SNP rs146589465-G was associated with an increased risk of cholangiocarcinoma, demonstrated by an odds ratio of 6.56 and significance at P=1.3×10^-3 when analyzed in a study involving affected individuals. This variant resulted in a substitution in the ATG7 protein (p.Asp522Glu) and was found to be rare in the population. In addition, the presence of this SNP was linked to a higher accumulation of p62 protein in tumors from carriers compared to non-carriers, indicating a defect in autophagy processes, supporting its role as a genetic risk factor for cholangiocarcinoma.
title: Genetic risk of cholangiocarcinoma is linked to the autophagy gene ATG7

finding: The SNP rs13061299 was associated with lysosomal calcium channels, which play a critical role in autophagy and cancer pathophysiology. In the context of the study reported, it was mentioned that IRE1α activity supports phagosomal calcium flux during macrophage responses to fungal infection, suggesting a link between this SNP and inflammatory responses relevant to pathogen interaction.
title: Non-canonical activation of IRE1α during Candida albicans infection enhances macrophage fungicidal activity

finding: The SNP rs11717303 mapped to the IQCJ-SHIP1 gene had a positive effect on total area of the corpus callosum, with a beta of 4.28 (EAF: 0.689, p = 4.54 × 10^-17).
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs12632564 showed a negative effect on total thickness of the corpus callosum, with a beta of -0.042 (EAF: 0.305, p = 2.59 × 10^-12).
title: The Genetic Architecture of the Human Corpus Callosum and its Subregions

finding: The SNP rs13071609 was associated with the epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and extracellular matrix (ECM) stiffness. The findings showed that this SNP could influence the dynamics of E/M cells, potentially contributing to the aggressiveness of cancer cell migration by modulating LOXL2 activity.
title: Nrf2 modulates the hybrid epithelial/mesenchymal phenotype and Notch signaling during collective cancer migration

finding: Found to be linked with prostate and ovarian cancer susceptibility in addition to breast cancer, confirming its pleiotropic associations.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: Identified as an endometrial cancer risk factor, this SNP was situated within a known prostate cancer risk locus.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: Known as a lead SNP for breast cancer, it presented unique pleiotropic associations with the cancers highlighted in this meta-analysis.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The rs12491955 variant was associated with increased SENP7 mRNA levels, with an adjusted P-value of 4.2×10^-302. It affected 5mC levels at 35 CpG sites, notably 30 of which clustered in two groups of ZNF genes located on chromosome 19. This finding underscored the genetic impact on the DNA methylome through the modulation of transcription factor expression.
title: Factors Driving DNA Methylation Variation in Human Blood

finding: The rs9823335 variant within the IQCB1 locus showed significant association with serum creatinine levels and corroborated previous associations with this gene, implicating it further in kidney function.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: This variant was found significantly associated with urea levels in the IQCB1 locus, presenting a novel association that reinforces the gene's relevance to kidney physiology.
title: Mendelian pathway analysis of laboratory traits reveals distinct roles for ciliary subcompartments in common disease pathogenesis

finding: The rs993387 SNP, located in an intron of the ARHGEF26 gene, was associated with susceptibility to Salmonella invasion. It showed significant deviations in p-values for both Salmonella Typhi (p=0.0001) and Salmonella Typhimurium (p=0.0004), suggesting a substantial impact on invasion. Specifically, the G allele of rs993387 was linked to increased susceptibility, with a more pronounced effect on S. Typhi invasion compared to S. Typhimurium.
title: ARHGEF26 enhances Salmonella invasion and inflammation in cells and mice

finding: The SNP rs13081759 was associated with the expression of Zona Pellucida Protein 2 (ZP2) and found to promote cell proliferation in the context of colon cancer. This observation was detailed in a study by Kraus et al. (2021), indicating that ZP2 had relevance not just in reproduction but also in cancer biology.
title: Intracellular fraction of zona pellucida protein 3 is required for the oocyte to embryo transition in mice

finding: The SNP rs2272007 was linked to diseases such as high blood pressure and sporadic thoracic aortic dissection (STAD) according to genome-wide association studies (GWAS). This SNP affects residue 39 in the ULK4 protein, with 68% of individuals carrying a T nucleotide, resulting in a lysine at position 39, and 32% carrying a C nucleotide, resulting in an arginine at this position. The study noted that while both K39 and R39 could similarly stabilize the ULK4 protein in the presence of ATP, a significant difference in ADP binding affinity was observed, indicating that altered nucleotide affinity may be associated with disease development as suggested by GWAS.
title: Nucleotide binding, evolutionary insights and interaction partners of the pseudokinase Unc-51-like kinase 4

finding: SNP rs9814991 was prioritized as the single putative causal variant from a set of fifty-seven variants linked to eosinophil counts, showing its significance in the analysis.
title: Predicted constrained accessible regions mark regulatory elements and causal variants

finding: The SNP rs13061364 was identified in relation to YAP1 amplification in osteosarcoma, as reported by Niu et al. (2021). The amplification of YAP1, found via allelic expression imbalance, suggested a mechanism whereby this SNP could influence tumorigenesis in similar contexts as Ewing sarcoma.
title: YAP1 is a key regulator of EWS::FLI1-dependent malignant transformation upon IGF-1 mediated reprogramming of bone mesenchymal stem cells

finding: SNP rs6809764 was identified as an sQTL for the PCYT1A gene, overlapping with an EFTUD2 binding site. The minor G allele was associated with increased PSI of the intron junction. EFTUD2 expression correlated with decreased junction usage, substantiating its role in mediating this sQTL. PCYT1A is crucial for phosphatidylcholine biosynthesis and its morphology changes during hypertrophy in chondrocytes relate to OA pathogenesis.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The FN-f-specific SNP rs7628578 was identified as a colocalized sQTL with the THR GWAS signal (index variant rs3774354), indicating a splicing impact on the novel OA candidate gene PBRM1.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The rs3774354 GWAS signal linked to THR corresponded to the FN-f-specific sQTL rs7628578, suggesting a novel potential role for PBRM1 in OA pathogenesis, particularly through its influence on splicing.
title: Response splicing QTLs in primary human chondrocytes identifies putative osteoarthritis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs4146336 was identified as a significant locus in the non-stratified GWAS for systemizing, with a p-value of 2.58×10−8. This locus mapped to two genes, LSAMP and PTMAP8, suggesting an involvement in the genetics of systemizing, a non-social autistic trait. The finding points towards the genetic basis for restricted and repetitive behavior in autism.
title: Social and non-social autism symptom and trait domains are genetically dissociable

finding: The SNP rs13061350 was associated with a drastic shift in lipid adducts detected by MALDI-IMS in colon cancer. This finding pointed to alterations in specific K(+) channels, indicating its relevance to both cancer biology and metabolic alterations.
title: Spatial Probabilistic Mapping of Metabolite Ensembles in Mass Spectrometry Imaging

finding: Associated with protective mechanisms for endometrial cancer risk, highlighting its significance in hormonal trait associations.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: Demonstrated associations with delayed menarche, providing insights into endometrial cancer risk.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations
