finding: The variant rs4428180 related to the transferrin gene (TF) was identified as associated with markers relevant to iron transport and levels in the body.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: Variant rs34457487 found in the MOBP gene was associated with QSM in the pallidum and putamen, connecting its relevance to myelin sheath structures.
title: Phenotypic and genetic associations of quantitative magnetic susceptibility in UK Biobank brain imaging

finding: The SNP rs116467226, which is an intronic variant by TPRG1, was identified as height-associated. This variant was previously not discovered in UK Biobank analyses, suggesting its role in height may only be recognized when considering the whole-genome sequence (WGS) polygenic background.
title: Joint modelling of whole genome sequence data for human height via approximate message passing

finding: The SNP rs13071746 was associated with epigenetic modifications in a variety of myeloid diseases, according to the publication. This study explored the potential of targeting these epigenetic changes for therapeutic purposes, indicating a specific relevance of this SNP in the context of cancer research.
title: ExoSloNano: Multi-Modal Nanogold Tags for identification of Macromolecules in Live Cells & Cryo-Electron Tomograms

finding: Found in the African (AFR) sample, this SNP was associated with PTSD, located intronic to CNTN6, with a significant p-value of 3.59×10⁻⁸.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The SNP rs13081776 was associated with the differential roles of activated regulatory T-Cells, dysfunctional, and senescent T-Cells that hinder the immune response in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC). This association suggested that it played a critical role in the immune evasion mechanisms of PDAC, which were directly linked to survival outcomes.
title: Single-cell immune multi-omics and repertoire analyses in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma reveal differential immunosuppressive mechanisms within different tumour microenvironments

finding: The SNP rs13081882 was associated with the regulation of epithelial to mesenchymal transition (EMT) processes in cancer. This SNP was examined in the context of a study that analyzed cytoskeletal dynamics during EMT, revealing its potential influence on therapeutic targets for cancer metastasis.
title: The cytolethal distending toxin modulates cell differentiation and elicits epithelial to mesenchymal transition

finding: The SNP rs12635900 was identified as an affinity-optimizing single nucleotide variant (SNV) that led to an 8-fold increase in ETS binding affinity. This variant was associated with QRS duration and resided within a putative developmental heart enhancer that interacts with the SCN5A promoter. This enhancer is significant because SCN5A encodes the major cardiac sodium channel, which is crucial for heart excitation and contraction, and variants affecting SCN5A are linked to various cardiac conduction traits and diseases.
title: Affinity-optimizing variants within cardiac enhancers disrupt heart development and contribute to cardiac traits

finding: The study highlighted an association between the abundance of the archaeon Methanobrevibacter and the SNP rs2276731 located in the ALDH1L1 gene. This SNP involves a nucleotide exchange (C instead of G, T) present in approximately 17% of the population, which correlates with the percentage of methane producers identified in the study (15%). This finding was supported by genetic correlation analyses with microbiome profiles from a large UK twin study, indicating a significant role of this genetic variant in methane emissions linked to dietary habits and gut microbiome composition.
title: Methane emission of humans is explained by dietary habits, host genetics, local formate availability and a uniform archaeome

finding: rs2871960 was identified as one of the most significant genetic associations for standing height in the UK Biobank data. Although the GWAS p-value was exceedingly low (2.4 x 10^-256), the fine-mapping analysis revealed that rs2871960 is unlikely to be the actual causal eQTL for ZBTB38 in skeletal muscle tissue, due to lack of signal clustering and low probability of colocalization (PIP = 2.75 x 10^-3). Simulation indicated that the observed significant TWAS associations in surrounding genes were artifacts driven by the LD hitchhiking effect from rs2871960.
title: Analyzing and Reconciling Colocalization and Transcriptome-wide Association Studies from the Perspective of Inferential Reproducibility

finding: This SNP was identified as impacting ADCY5 expression through alteration in enhancer regulation, unveiling its connection to type 2 diabetes mechanisms.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: Associated with ADCY5, these SNPs provided insights into gene regulation mechanisms significant in diabetes context.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: This SNP indicated its role in the expression of ADCY5, reinforcing its association with mechanisms underlying type 2 diabetes.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: This SNP was shown to influence ADCY5 expression, suggesting a role in genetic pathways related to insulin regulation.
title: INFIMA leverages multi-omics model organism data to identify effector genes of human GWAS variants

finding: The SNP rs694611 was associated with mean cortical thickness on chromosome 3, with a p-value of 2.10e-17 and explaining 0.22% of the variance. This SNP is located within the RPSA gene, which is significant for early cortical development.
title: Larger cerebral cortex is genetically correlated with greater frontal area and dorsal thickness

finding: The SNP rs520558 acted as an eQTL for the SENP7 gene, which is involved in DNA methylation regulation. It influenced distal CpG sites (cg24214260) through an eQTL-mediation mechanism, leading to modified methylation levels.
title: Genetic impacts on DNA methylation help elucidate regulatory genomic processes

finding: The SNP rs13061356 was associated with a study that explored the impact of very heavy ions in therapy, particularly in the context of Neon Minibeam Radiation Therapy. This study suggested a renewed interest in the use of heavy ions as a therapeutic approach and highlighted the potential relevance of this SNP in relation to treatment efficacy and interactions with oxidative processes, possibly linked to the chemiluminescence effects discussed in the broader context of noble gases and their biological impact.
title: Possible Mechanisms Of Action Of Light Inert Gases On Chemiluminescence Arising As A Result Of Lipid Peroxidation

finding: The rs12497850 variant was linked to the LAMB2 gene in the rare coding variant burden analysis, indicating its potential role in influencing PD risk.
title: Expanding Parkinson’s disease genetics: novel risk loci, genomic context, causal insights and heritable risk

finding: The missense variant rs3197999 in the MST1 gene, leading to the R703C substitution, was linked to an increased risk for Crohn's disease. This variant affected the abundance of the MSP-RON protein complex through weakened protein-protein interactions, which resulted in decreased intracellular signaling and potential changes in macrophage activation and epithelial cell survival.
title: MecCog: A knowledge representation framework for genetic disease mechanism

finding: This SNP, a proxy for SLE sentinel rs6762714, was located in the sixth intron of LPP and skipped the LPP promoter to interact with the promoter of the BCL6 gene, crucial for TFH function.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: This sentinel SLE SNP rs6762714 is linked to rs34631447 which was shown to interact with the distal regulatory region influencing BCL6 expression in TFH cells.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: Identified as a proxy for rs6762714, this SNP was also shown to interact with gene BCL6, further confirming its role in SLE pathophysiology.
title: Human follicular helper T cell promoter connectomes reveal novel genes and regulatory elements at SLE GWAS loci

finding: The SNP rs1800734 was identified as enhancing the expression of the DCLK3 gene through long-range interactions. This finding was pertinent to the context of colorectal cancer progression, indicating a direct link between the genetic variant and the disease outcome.
title: CTCF and cohesin promote focal detachment of DNA from the nuclear lamina

finding: The SNP rs2681781, which was a synonymous variant in the CAMKV gene, was one of the 45 SNPs that were associated with 12 trait domains, suggesting its involvement in a range of traits.
title: A global overview of pleiotropy and genetic architecture in complex traits

finding: The SNP rs2230590, a nonsynonymous variant in the MST1R gene, was also among the 45 SNPs associated with 12 trait domains, highlighting its potential functional impact on trait variation.
title: A global overview of pleiotropy and genetic architecture in complex traits

finding: The variant rs1800734 was identified as enhancing DCLK3 expression through long-range interaction, which promoted colorectal cancer progression. This finding related to the context of colorectal cancer (CRC) and was considered an original discovery linking non-coding variants to oncogenic outcomes.
title: The histone modifier KAT2A presents a selective target in a subset of well-differentiated microsatellite-stable colorectal cancers

finding: The Tyr2740Phe variant was classified as Benign but affected a conserved and unstructured region of DNAH12, corroborating characteristics of a functional motif.
title: MotSASi: Functional Short Linear Motifs (SLiMs) prediction based on genomic single nucleotide variants and structural data

finding: The stop gain variant rs780671030 (p.Arg722X) in ALDH1L1 was uniquely present in the Finnish population and was associated with a mean reduction in serum glycine levels of 0.03 mmol/l, which could elevate the risk for several cardiometabolic disorders.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: Research identified a significant association between the rs1049296 SNP and sleep disorders related to iron metabolism among individuals with autism spectrum disorder, highlighted by Skonieczna-Żydecka et al. in 2020.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The SNP rs3811647 was mentioned in the study regarding iron metabolism genes and sleep disorders among Polish individuals with ASD, as presented by Skonieczna-Żydecka et al. in 2020.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: Ramezanpour et al. in 2020 associated the rs4618210A>G variant in the PLCL2 gene with myocardial infarction, highlighting its clinical significance.
title: Comprehensive analysis of next-generation sequencing data in COVID-19 and its secondary complications

finding: The SNP rs13071580 was linked to dietary fats and serum cholesterol levels that are indicative of liver cancer risk in the context of a systematic review and meta-analysis. This findings suggest that variations in this SNP may influence metabolic responses to high-fat diets, further emphasizing its potential role in cancer susceptibility.
title: High-fat diet-induced obesity increases susceptibility to endogenous and ethyl carbamate-induced somatic mutagenesis

finding: The SNP rs556874, located in the fourth intron of the gene WNT5A, was part of a significant three-node subnetwork identified as the Wnt subnetwork. This subnetwork involved genetic interactions that influenced lung function traits in SSc patients, indicating its potential role in disease mechanisms.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs1449292, located in an intron of the gene RBMS3, was also part of the significant Wnt subnetwork. Its interactions contributed to understanding how genetic factors may influence lung function in SSc.
title: Genetic interactions affect lung function in patients with systemic sclerosis

finding: The SNP rs13081873 was associated with metabolic heterogeneity in colorectal cancer. Specifically, higher expression of the free fraction of NAD(P)H was linked to high-grade tumors and tumor metastasis. This correlation indicates that this SNP may play a role in the tumor biology context, specifically concerning patients' tumor metabolism, which was significantly more heterogeneous compared to cultured cell lines and tumor xenografts.
title: Metabolic heterogeneity of colorectal cancer as a prognostic factor: insights gained from fluorescence lifetime imaging

finding: The SNP rs2251219 demonstrated a pleiotropic effect affecting several proteins, sharing genetic associations with various diseases and traits. This was highlighted as a significant example of regulatory pleiotropy related to complex disease traits.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The SNP rs13092060 was linked to colibactin-producing <italic>E. coli</italic> which was shown to induce the formation of invasive carcinomas in a chronic inflammation-associated mouse model. This finding was significant as it suggested a direct genetic association relating to colorectal cancer exacerbation driven by bacterial adhesion mechanisms.
title: Colibactin-induced genotoxicity and colorectal cancer exacerbation critically depends on adhesin-mediated epithelial binding

finding: The SNP rs5186 in the AGTR1 gene was associated with decreased eGFR in patients with type 2 diabetes in Mexico City. This finding highlighted the potential role of genetic variations in renal function within diabetic populations.
title: Identification of novel prognostic targets in acute kidney injury using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: rs62273067 was associated with Acidaminococcus and successfully replicated at nominal significance as well.
title: Inter-determination of blood metabolite levels and gut microbiome supported by Mendelian randomization

finding: The SNP rs348873 showed an association with lincRNA RP11-290F20.3 in FCGR3A+ monocytes, highlighting its role in gene regulation.
title: Expression QTLs in single-cell sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs35124509 from locus 3p11.1 was associated with multiple central FCs, such as the connectivity between the left posterior part of the superior temporal sulcus and the left temporal pole (Pole↔STSp) among others, all related to semantic language processing. Its minor allele was linked to various associations identified as relevant in FC studies.
title: The genetic architecture of language functional connectivity

finding: The analysis identified rs823955 as significantly associated with Alzheimer’s disease, adding to the growing list of SNPs linked with neurodegenerative disorders.
title: Deep Learning-based Feature Extraction with MRI Data in Neuroimaging Genetics for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs1354034 exhibited heterogeneous quantile effects that were not detected using linear regression. It showed a strong non-additive association with platelet width distribution, linking it to increased expression of the gene ARHGEF3 in platelets, particularly with age. This SNP was shown to disrupt a conserved GATA motif and impact transcription of nearby regulatory elements, indicating its functional significance in platelet-related phenotypes.
title: Quantile Regression for biomarkers in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs10428126 presented strong evidence of impacting transcriptional activation in beta cells, corroborating prior findings related to its islet chromatin accessibility.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: The SNP rs13096599 was nominated as a causal variant based on its substantial impact on transcriptional activity during MPRA testing.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: Evidence showed that the SNP rs17748864 significantly altered transcriptional activity in MPRA, marking it as a notable variant for T2D.
title: Functional characterization of thousands of type 2 diabetes-associated and chromatin-modulating variants under steady state and endoplasmic reticulum stress

finding: An association was identified between the SNP rs10513664, an intronic SNP in MECOM gene, and methylation level at mt-tRNA-G (position 9999). MECOM is a transcription factor related to hematopoietic stem cell maintenance, underscoring its potential importance in blood-related pathophysiology.
title: Nuclear genetic regulation of human mitochondrial RNA modification

finding: The SNP rs13081946 was associated with the modulation of macrophage roles in cancer development and therapy, which linked high macrophage activity to cancer progression and response to therapies. This finding was contextualized within the exploration of tumor-associated macrophages in the immune evasion mechanisms of solid tumors.
title: Advancing CAR T-Cell Therapy: Simultaneously Attack Tumor and Immunosuppressive Cells in the Tumor Microenvironment

finding: The SNP rs13061380 was associated with specific phenotypic outputs related to cancer evolution as reported by Shlyakhtina et al. (2021). The findings indicated that this SNP influenced the adaptability of clonal cell populations, contributing to their phenotypic diversity and plasticity in response to environmental cues.
title: Cytoplasmic lncRNAs nucleate signalling pathways to define metastable state dynamics and determine phenotypic output

finding: The SNP rs12636352 was identified as a new BMI-related signal in the trans-ethnic meta-analysis with strong associations, especially from HISLA and AAAGC results.
title: Ancestral diversity improves discovery and fine-mapping of genetic loci for anthropometric traits - the Hispanic/Latino Anthropometry Consortium

finding: SNP rs6444469 presented genome-wide significant associations with CSF-Ttau levels in the EMIF-AD MBD cohort, particularly showing stronger effects in females (P-value = 1.47E-04) compared to males suggesting sex-specific differences in its association.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarkers in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs1393060, located proximal to GMNC, was mentioned alongside rs6444469, showcasing sex-specific differences in association with CSF-Ttau levels, with a strong link in females (P-value = 4.57E-10) compared to males (P-value = 0.03), reinforcing earlier findings on the locus.
title: Genome-wide association study of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarkers in the EMIF-AD Multimodal Biomarker Discovery dataset

finding: The SNP rs1368575 was part of a novel cluster associated with tissue contrast measures in the cerebrum. Its findings indicated a significant relationship with white-grey matter intensity differences.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs9290432 was associated with multiple cortical regions' tissue contrast measures and is an eQTL of PLD1, which regulates amyloid precursor protein in Alzheimer's disease pathology.
title: Enhanced Brain Imaging Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs2228000, located within the XPC gene, was found to be significantly associated with cancer susceptibility. This conclusion was drawn from a comprehensive analysis that included 26,835 cancer cases and 37,069 controls. The findings indicated that variations in this SNP could contribute to the risk of developing various cancers, thereby linking it to underlying mechanisms of DNA repair and their implications in cancer pathology.
title: CometChip Enables Parallel Analysis of Multiple DNA Repair Activities

finding: The variant rs28350 was identified as the lead variant with a significant association to the gene CCK in relation to BMI, having a PPA of 88.4%. This variant was linked to CCK through a distal enhancer located more than 110 kbp away.
title: A Unifying Statistical Framework to Discover Disease Genes from GWAS

finding: The rs9831894 locus located at 3q13.33 was found to be significantly inversely associated with the risk of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL). This finding emerged from a genome-wide association study, which underscored the potential relevance of this SNP to cancer risk, particularly in the context of fine-scale chromatin architecture dynamics as elucidated by the MOSAIC framework.
title: Extensive Chromatin Structure-Function Association Revealed by Accurate Compartmentalization Characterization

finding: The SNP rs631312 at 3p22.1 near MOBP was tied to increased expression of MOBP specifically in oligodendrocytes and marked as a genome-wide significant finding.
title: Genetic, transcriptomic, histological, and biochemical analysis of progressive supranuclear palsy implicates glial activation and novel risk genes

finding: The 'T' allele of the top eSNP (rs13068288) for ZNF589 increased its transcription in resting T cells but reduced its expression after PHA stimulation, indicating a change in direction of eQTL effects between cellular conditions.
title: Neonatal genetics of gene expression reveal the origins of autoimmune and allergic disease risk

finding: The SNP rs75218075, located in the WDR49 gene, also demonstrated a significant association with the TP53 R249S mutation in HCC with AFB1 and HBV exposure. Individuals with the TT genotype at this locus had a higher risk for the R249S mutation, with an odds ratio of 5.79 (95% CI = 1.33–25.13). Moreover, WDR49 mRNA levels were significantly lower in HCC tissues compared to paired non-tumor tissues, but there was no correlation of expression with genotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study of TP53 R249S mutation in hepatocellular carcinoma with aflatoxin B1 exposure and hepatitis B virus infection in Guangxi

finding: The SNP rs13061380 was associated with the regulation of EMT-inducing transcription factor SNAIL, which impacts epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) processes. This was placed within the context of studying phenotypic heterogeneity in aggressive cancer behavior, particularly in PMC42-LA cells, where fluctuations in SNAIL during cell division contributed to spontaneous phenotypic switching.
title: Population dynamics of epithelial-mesenchymal heterogeneity in cancer cells

finding: This variant was previously linked to email contact, showing higher odds of receiving an invitation to participate in at least one optional survey.
title: Genetic predictors of participation in optional components of UK Biobank

finding: The rs5186 polymorphism in the AGTR1 gene was found to be associated with decreased estimated glomerular filtration rate in patients with type 2 diabetes, signifying its potential role in renal complications.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The polymorphism rs616147 in the MOBP gene was recognized as a risk factor for Parkinson's disease, contributing to its role in neuroinflammation.
title: Identification of key genes and signaling pathway in the pathogenesis of Huntington’s disease via bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The variant rs139637885 was identified as an eQTL for the gene MUC20P1, demonstrating widespread sharing across various tissues, with the exception of lymphocyte cell lines (LCLs). FastGxC captured this variant as a sh-eQTL, indicating its general regulatory effect, while also recognizing it as a sp-eQTL specifically in LCLs and a less pronounced sp-eQTL in thyroid tissue.
title: Fast and powerful statistical method for context-specific QTL mapping in multi-context genomic studies

finding: The SNP rs13071536 was associated with the mechanisms of immune evasion in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL), specifically related to the expression of interferon-related genes by mesenchymal stromal cells (MSCs) co-cultured with BCP-ALL cells. This expression was selectively induced by BCP-ALL cells, especially those positive for the ETV6-RUNX1 fusion, indicating that rs13071536 might be involved in the pathobiology of BCP-ALL through its influence on immune signaling pathways.
title: B-Cell Precursor Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia elicits an Interferon-α/β response in Bone Marrow-derived Mesenchymal Stroma

finding: The SNP rs12632235 within ABI3BP showed a suggestive association with alcohol dependence in approximately 7,000 Dutch subjects, indicating its potential role in predisposition to alcohol use disorders.
title: Genome-wide association mapping of ethanol sensitivity in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The SNP rs142338804 within SENP7 was significantly associated with drinks per week in a combined sample of around 1 million individuals of European ancestry, highlighting its relevance to alcohol consumption behavior.
title: Genome-wide association mapping of ethanol sensitivity in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The SNP rs145898511 within SENP7 showed a suggestive association with bitter alcohol consumption in approximately 370,000 subjects of European ancestry, reinforcing its connection to alcohol-related preferences.
title: Genome-wide association mapping of ethanol sensitivity in the Diversity Outbred mouse population

finding: The SNP rs1601440 was found to be associated with excessive daytime sleepiness and daytime napping in humans. It is located within the same topologically associated domain (TAD) as the gene CADM2, which is implicated in sleep regulation through its role in synaptic adhesion and neuronal signaling.
title: Cross-species evidence for a developmental origin of adult hypersomnia with loss of synaptic adhesion molecules beat-Ia/CADM2

finding: The study identified SNP rs3181077, which was located between the chemokine-related genes CCR1 and CCR3. Previous GWAS of NT1 had reported associations with this SNP, implying that it might affect the expression levels of chemokine-related genes. Given the observed decrease in expression levels of chemokines CCL5 and CCR4 in NT1, this finding highlighted rs3181077 as a candidate relevant to NT1 pathology.
title: Multiomics analysis of narcolepsy T cells: global hypomethylation in solo-WCGW motif linked to T cell proliferation

finding: The SNP rs13081968 was linked to the phenomenon of clonal hematopoiesis associated with myelodysplasia syndrome. The original finding highlighted how this SNP could play a role in the development of clonal expansions and the associated risk factors for cardiovascular diseases, demonstrating a significant connection to neoplastic processes.
title: SRSF2 transcriptional function maintains genome integrity during cell division

finding: The SNP rs53576 was found to be associated with greater cortical surface area (cSA) in men, specifically in the left middle temporal and fusiform gyri and larger subcortical volumes in the left amygdala. Men with GG homozygous genotype exhibited reduced empathy and prosocial behaviors, implicating its role in socio-emotional functioning.
title: Situating the oxytocin receptor gene polymorphisms in the context of structural and connectome-level substrates and association with endogenous oxytocin

finding: For SNP rs1042778, men demonstrated greater cSA in the right inferior temporal gyrus and structural connectivity differences compared to targeted allele carriers. This SNP was linked to reduced prosocial behaviors and was noted for showing negative correlations with functional connectivity metrics, presenting ties to socio-emotional processing.
title: Situating the oxytocin receptor gene polymorphisms in the context of structural and connectome-level substrates and association with endogenous oxytocin

finding: The rs2254298 SNP showed larger cSA in men, particularly within the left middle temporal gyrus, precentral gyrus, and superior parietal gyrus. This variant was associated with smaller bilateral amygdala volumes, and impacted socio-emotional behaviors such as autism spectrum disorder and depression among women.
title: Situating the oxytocin receptor gene polymorphisms in the context of structural and connectome-level substrates and association with endogenous oxytocin

finding: The SNP rs13071572 was associated with mechanisms of acute kidney injury (AKI) in a study regarding cisplatin-induced AKI. The findings indicated that variants linked to this SNP were correlated with worse outcomes in kidney resilience. In this context, the study explored several genetic mitigations, highlighting the role of QPRT and its regulation by the transcription factor HNF4alpha, in maintaining NAD+ levels in kidney cells.
title: HNF4α mediated QPRT expression in the kidney facilitates resilience against acute kidney injury

finding: The rs53576 SNP was associated with the functionality of the OXT receptor (OXTR) in humans, specifically noting that the GG genotype led to a higher production of OXTRs compared to the AG or AA genotypes. This increased availability of OXTRs correlated with an enhanced ability to discriminate language under noisy conditions, highlighting the important role of OXT in sensory processing and behavioral response to social auditory information. Moreover, the text suggested that OXT may modulate maternal vocalizations and is important for understanding maternal care behaviors.
title: An acute dose of intranasal oxytocin rapidly increases maternal communication and maintains maternal care in primiparous postpartum California mice

finding: The SNP rs13100616 situated in the lncRNA KCNMB2-AS1 was observed to be up-regulated in the microglial population in ALS patients. This finding highlighted the possible contribution of KCNMB2-AS1 to the immune response or neuroinflammation in the context of ALS.
title: Transcriptional profiling of human brain cortex identifies novel lncRNA-mediated networks dysregulated in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

finding: The CLASP2*L163P variant was associated with neurodegeneration based on meta-analysis, reinforcing its relevance in the context of Alzheimer's disease.
title: In vivo validation of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease genetic risk factors

finding: The SNP rs53576 showed a positive correlation with choosing alcopop (ρ = 0.0793, P < 0.0001) and beer (ρ = 0.0371, P = 0.0162), indicating its relevance in determining food choices among participants.
title: Using Genetic Information to Improve the Prediction of Individual Food Choice: A Case Study of Alcoholic Beverages

finding: The SNP rs9854771 exhibited associations with pancreatic cancer risk, supporting earlier findings in separate studies.
title: Genome-wide association meta-analysis identifies novel GP2 gene risk variants for pancreatic cancer in the Japanese population
